ovdesc.p: On flagging CREATE.FACILITY field in PRESYNDICATION.FILE, appropriate facility records are created in IHLD status.
Currently direct creation of facility record otherwise than through Presyndication file is not permitted. Hence, the records created in IHLD status cannot be deleted until first authorisation.

In the FACILITY file the bank may record details of type of credit line, it validity in terms of drawings and maturity, the countries of risk and exposure, the rate of commitment fee and its calculation methodology, the rates and method of calculation of interest for drawings under the line, details of participation and the appropriate lending rates applicable to each participant etc.

In the event that the bank desires to phase out disbursement, it would be possible to break the facility into different tranches. Both sequential and overlapping types of tranches may be defined. It would be possible to record the details of participation at the tranche level as well as other covenants like currencies in which drawings are permissible and currencies prohibited, the validity of the tranche, the customers who may draw under the tranche and the amounts reserved and allowed to them, the maximum number of loans and currrencies in which drawings are permissible under the tranche etc.

Field that indicates whether the Facility is available for drawings or not.

In many instances there could be a need to temporarily suspend the facility for a certain time period. The bank would require suspension of facility in instances where documentation is pending (or to be renewed), need for additional collateral or existing collateral to be substituted etc. In such circumstances, the facility is withdrawn for a certain time period till such time the requirement is fulfilled.
During such period of suspension the bank may or may not charge commitment fee for the undrawn portion.
One of the following values are allowed in this field;
YES - Facility is available for drawing
STF - Suspend Take Fee - Facility is suspended but fee would be taken for the period of suspension.
SWF - Suspend Waive Fee - Facility is suspended and commitment fee is waived during the period of suspension

When a revolving facility is issued, the phased reduction of facility amounts could be defined in this set of fields.
For a non revolving facility, repayment schedules could be defined in SL.REPAYMENT.SCHEDULES table.

For a revolving facility, the facility amount could be reduced in a phased manner by using DEC.EFF.DT, DEC.AMOUNT and DEC.PERC. Based on input in this set of fields an internal file called SL.EXPOSURE.LEVEL would be built.
When drawings are made, validations would be performed in order to check that the drawings does not breach the exposure levels. The following example would illustrate the functionality.
A facility is granted for 1,000,000 with value date as 01JAN02, maturity date 01JAN05 with reductions as follows;
DEC.EFF.DT DEC.AMOUNT DEC.PERC

Assume a single drawdown is made on value date 01JAN02 for the entire amount of 1,000,000. The latest maturity date that may be given for this drawing can be 31DEC02 as a decrease of 25% is contemplated on 01JAN03. If the borrower has made the drawing for 750,000 the latest maturity date that could be given is 31DEC03 as maximum exposure permitted beyond this date is 250,000 only.
In case the borrower has taken the loan (full value of 1,000,000) for a shorter period, say with value date 01JAN02 and maturity date 31OCT02. On this maturity date, there are two options open;
(a) To rollover the loan in full with maturity date less than 01JAN03

(b) To split the loan so that one or more loans aggregating to value 250,000 have maturity date less than 01JAN03 and one or more loans aggregating to value 750,000 having maturity date less than 01JAN04

On each Exposure Date, LIVECMT would be reversed out with an amount equal to Dec.Amount. If no input is made in Dec.Eff.Dt set of fields, LIVECMT should be reversed on the Maturity.Date for the full value. This is to ensure that the utilized amount under the Facility never exceeds the Exposure Level.

Field to capture the consideration when a mere participant enters the syndicate buying a portion of the contingent share from one of the existing participants.

A bank that acts as a mere participant could enter the syndicate right at the beginning or during the life of the syndicate by buying the share (or a portion of it) from an existing participant. For the later type, the transaction could involve a premium/discount paid/received by the buying bank.

This field is used to capture the consideration (grossed-up to include the contingent portion plus the premium/discount portion) for the transaction. The premium or discount could be either written directly to P&L or amortised over the life of the Facility. The account from which the consideration is paid out is provided in Bs.Settle.Account.

For example - T24 bank enters the syndicate buying a contingent portion of 1,000,000 from bank A for a premium of 10,000. In such case SL.AMOUNT would show 1,000,000 and value to be input in Bs.Consideration field is 1,010,000. The decision to amortise or not is provided in Bs.Amortisation field. The accounting entries that would be raised are
Dr Amortisation asset type / P&L category * 10,000
Cr Account in Bs.Settle.Account 10,000
* Category defined in SL.PARAMETER based on decision to amortise.
In the above instance if the buy happens at a discount of 10,000 the value to be input in Bs.Consideration is (1,000,000 - 10,000) = 990,000

Identifies the manner in which overdue payments are handled. The default for all contracts is AUTOMATIC.
Two options are provided;

AUTOMATIC - When a commitment fee schedule is processed, accounting entries would be passed across the liquidation account for the entire dues and the respective participant's share would be disbursed through their Nostro accounts automatically. In this scenario, the Agent expects funds to be credited to his Nostro on the due dates and hence automates the liquidation and disbursement entries.

INTERNAL - In this scenario the Agent would pay the participants only on actual receipt of funds in his Nostro/liquidation account. The Agent's share (in case the Agent is also a participant) would be liquidated to the account provided in the deal for the respective due but no amounts would be disbursed to the participants. The overdue amounts would get captured in SL.OD.DUES and SL.OD.PART files. On receipt of funds, the application SL.OD.DUES may be used to pay off the participant's share as well as to reverse out own share in the internal account where Agent's share is stored.

In case the borrower has followed a different method of rounding with that compared to the Agent, the participant's share of interest, commitment fee and tax on both could differ. In such scenario the borrower would remit an amount different to the one calculated and stored by the Agent in his overdue files. Hence an application SL.ROUND.ADJ has been provided where the Agent could re-allocate the share of interest, commitment fee and tax thereon between the participants, to be in line with the borrower's calculation. This front-end could also be used in case the Agent does a skimming of the interest (on loans) or commitment fee. In this case the borrower is charged a different rate than the one quoted by the participants and the Agent skims the difference.
Liquidation mode INTERNAL could hence be used where ;
(a) The agent would repay the participants only on sighting the funds
(b) Where the agent would require to do rounding adjustments to re-allocate the participant's share
Only allowed values are AUTOMATIC and INTERNAL

The basis of calculation of commitment fee. This field indicates the base on which commitment fee would be calculated.
Following values are allowed
O - Original - Base amount is the SL.AMOUNT through the life of the contract. Fee would be calculated for the period value.Date to Draw.Mat.Date

U - UNUSED - Initial calculation is on the value in SL.AMOUNT. Whenever drawings are made, the fee amount is re-calulated on the aggregate commitment that is unused (undrawn). Fee would be calculated for the period Value.Date to Maturity.Date
TU - Tranche UNUSED - Fee calculation is on the unused amount in each tranche. Fee would be calculated for period Tranche.Start.Date to Tranche.End.Date for each tranche

CA - Committment Available/Unavailable - Fee will be calculated on the tranche commitment available and unavailable amount.Fee for unavailable amount will be calculated using reserved tranche amount (RESERVED.TRANCHE = YES) and fee percentage to be applied for unavailable amount can be defined in CMT.FEE.UNAVL field.Fee for the available amount will be calculated based on the unused tranche amount.

OU - Original/Unused - Fee will be calculated for original and unused tranche amounts based on BAND/LEVEL definition.Fee for the original amount will be based on SL.AMOUNT and fee percentage defined in CMT.FEE.UNAVL.Fee for the unused live tranche amount will be based on fee percentage defined in CMT.FEE.PERC.
2 type A alpha characters
Only allowed values are O, U, TU, CA and OU
Reserved tranche mandatory for CA basis.

This field holds the 4 digit activity code generated by the system and written in the form SL-....
Each of the 4 digits are arrived at as below :
The first digit indicates the application for which the activity has been generated. Presently it has three values viz. 1 - PRE 2 - FACILITY and 3 - SL.LOAN
The second digit indicates the operation done under each application. Presently it has six values viz. 0 - OTHERS 1 - INPUT 2 - AMENDMENT 3 - NOTICE 4 - CONFIRMATION 5 - REVERSAL

The third digit indicates the component for which the message is being generated viz. Principal or Interest or commitment fee etc. Presently it has five values viz. 0 - OTHERS 1 - PRINCIPAL 2 - COMMITMENT FEE 3 - INTEREST 4 - CHARGES

The fourth digit indicates to whom the message is being generated, whether to the participant or to the borrower or to both. Presently it has three values viz. 1 - PARTICIPANT ONLY 2 - PARTICIPANT AND BORROWER 3 - BORROWER ONLY
For example when a new facility is granted, the activity generated would be SL-2102 meaning 2-FACILITY, 1-INPUT, 0-OTHERS(since it involves all components) and 2-PARTICIPANTS AND BORROWER.

This field has the Associated set of fields PRODUCT.AMT,PRODUCT.TR.CODE, PRODUCT.TR.AMT for defining multiple product utilisation for the facility amount under each tranche
An example to define the Functionality

The field PRODUCT.TYPE and PRODUCT.AMT is used to define the amount utilisation under the product and the associated sub-value fields PRODUCT.TR.CODE and PROD.TR.AMT is used to define the Tranche level utilisation on each Product.
Consider a Total Facility amount of 100M with TR1 as 50M, TR2 as 30M and TR3 as 20M
The PRODUCT.TYPE and PRODUCT.AMT can be defined as below
LOANS USD 100M(LN-PRODUCT) TR1 50M, TR2 30M, TR3 20M
GTEES USD 100M(GT-PRODUCT) TR1 50M, TR2 30M, TR3 20M
SBLC's USD 100M(SC-PRODUCT) TR1 50M, TR2 30M, TR3 20M , The tranche codes and amounts can be defined in PRODUCT.TR.CODE and PRODUCT.TR.AMT

The above examples determines that a Facility of 100M can be utilised in the LN product type by a maximum of 50M utilisation from TR1, 30M from TR2 and 20M from TR3. Similarly for the GT and SC products. The amount utilisation is in the first come first serve basis and the utilisation on each product is allowed only on the outstanding tranche amount
Allowed values in this field are LN, SC, GT, LCE and LCI.
LN implies Loan Product
SC implies Stand by Letter of Credit
GT implies Guarantee assistance.
LCI implies Import Letter of Credit.
LCE implies Export Letter of Credit.
Default value is Null implying loan type product.
Sum of the product amount can be greater than the Facility amount
